sentences.en: Air bags were designed to inflate rapidly in an accident.
sentences.cn: 设计气囊是为了在事故中快速地充气.
安全气囊遇到撞击立即膨胀。

sentences.en: Being both lighter than air and nonflammable, helium is used to inflate balloons and airships.
sentences.cn: 由于既比空气轻又不可燃, 氦用作充气球和飞艇.

sentences.en: Deflate the  tire and then inflate it afresh.
sentences.cn: 把轮胎的气放掉,然后重新充上气.

sentences.en: Don's lifejacket had failed to inflate.
sentences.cn: 唐的救生衣未能充气膨胀。

sentences.en: Down power to inflate and fill up with air.
sentences.cn: 蓬松度是指羽绒蓄含空气和膨胀的能力.

sentences.en: He who is GREat need not inflate himself.
sentences.cn: 伟大的人不需要自吹自擂.

sentences.en: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
sentences.cn: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

sentences.en: Individual professors inflate grades after consumer - conscious administrators hound them into it.
sentences.cn: 个别教授在“重视顾客”的行政负责人的唆使下,抬高分数.

sentences.en: Inflate the cuff of the endotracheal tube to check for leaks.
sentences.cn: 注入气体使套囊膨胀,以此来检查套囊是否漏气.

sentences.en: Inflate your life jacket by pulling sharply on the cord.
sentences.cn: 猛拽绳扣使你的救生衣充气。

sentences.en: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
sentences.cn: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。
我应该夸大工作经验 吗 ?

sentences.en: The buyers bid against each other and often inflate the prices they pay.
sentences.cn: 买主们竞相投标,往往人为地提高价钱.

sentences.en: The pictures hereinafter are the contrast before and after inflate.
sentences.cn: 该产品图片是产品膨胀前后对比.

sentences.en: The promotion of a big release can inflate a film'sfinal cost.
sentences.cn: 大规模发行所需的广告宣传会增加一部电影的最终成本。

sentences.en: When educational function of status excessively inflate, higher meaning of education will be distorted and lost.
sentences.cn: 当教育“身份”功能过度膨胀时, 它就会扭曲和损害更高意义上的育人功能.

words.tran_cn: 膨胀的，可充气的；得意的
通货膨胀的；充了气的；价格飞涨的；（植物）肿胀的
通货膨胀的；通货膨胀倾向的；通货膨胀引起的
膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡
膨胀（inflate的过去式和过去分词）；使充气；抬高（物价）

trans.tran_en: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

trans.tran_cn: 使充气； 使膨胀； 使得意， 使骄傲； 抬高； 使膨胀
trans.tran_en: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

trans.tran_cn: 使充气（于轮胎、气球等），（使）膨胀，（使）通货膨胀，物价上涨
